cards.name: Fountain Watch
cards.text: Artifacts and enchantments you control have shroud. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities.)
cards.flavor: The Cho-Arrim didn't rely only on a secret location to protect their Fountain.
cards.originalText: Artifacts and enchantments you control can't be the target of spells or abilities.

cards.name: Fresh Volunteers
cards.flavor: Every Cho-Arrim villager is a potential warrior; when they are called, they abandon their peaceful way of life and take up arms to defend it.

cards.name: Honor the Fallen
cards.text: Exile all creature cards from all graveyards. You gain 1 life for each card exiled this way.
cards.flavor:
"May the River claim Cho-Manno's body, wherever it lies."
—Ta-Karnst, Cho-Arrim healer
cards.originalText: Remove all creature cards in all graveyards from the game. You gain 1 life for each card removed this way.

cards.name: Ignoble Soldier
cards.text: Whenever Ignoble Soldier becomes blocked, prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by it this turn.
cards.flavor: Cowardice is a term invented by those with no cunning.
cards.originalText: Whenever Ignoble Soldier becomes blocked, prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by it this turn.

cards.name: Inviolability
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to enchanted creature.
cards.flavor: A soldier's faith is magic strong enough to protect against any blade.
cards.originalText: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to enchanted creature.

cards.name: Ivory Mask
cards.text: You have shroud. (You can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
cards.flavor: "I did not choose my role, Orim," said Cho-Manno patiently, "and I suspect Gerrard did not choose his."
cards.originalText: You can't be the target of spells or abilities.

cards.name: Jhovall Queen
cards.text: Vigilance
cards.flavor: War-trained jhovalls eat twice their weight in war-trained soldiers daily.
cards.originalText: Attacking doesn't cause Jhovall Queen to tap.

cards.name: Jhovall Rider
cards.text: Trample
cards.flavor: Don't be fooled by the riders' fluid grace—it takes years of practice to ride these beasts.
cards.originalText: Trample

cards.name: Last Breath
cards.text: Exile target creature with power 2 or less. Its controller gains 4 life.
cards.flavor: "The River flows. My soul returns."

rulings.text: If the creature is an illegal target when Last Breath tries to resolve, it won't resolve and none of its effects will happen. Its controller won't gain 4 life.

cards.originalText: Remove target creature with power 2 or less from the game. Its controller gains 4 life.

cards.name: Moment of Silence
cards.text: Target player skips their next combat phase this turn.
cards.flavor: The silence commemorates not those who've died, but those about to.

rulings.text: The player skips their next combat phase this turn (if any). If they manage to have two combat phases, then only their next one combat phase is skipped.
It must be used before the combat phase starts or it has no effect.
If cast on a player when it is not their turn, it has no effect.

cards.originalText: Target player skips his or her combat phase this turn.

cards.name: Moonlit Wake
cards.text: Whenever a creature dies, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor:
"As long as Rushwood glows, no life is ever truly lost."
—Ta-Karnst, Cho-Arrim healer
cards.originalText: Whenever a creature is put into a graveyard from play, you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Muzzle
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Prevent all damage that would be dealt by enchanted creature.
cards.flavor:
Clenched teeth do not bite.
—Cho-Arrim saying
cards.originalText: Prevent all damage that would be dealt by enchanted creature.

cards.name: Nightwind Glider
cards.text: Flying, protection from black
cards.flavor: Once you learn to float on the shadows, you'll never fear them again.
cards.originalText: Flying, protection from black

cards.name: Noble Purpose
cards.text: Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage, you gain that much life.
cards.flavor: Fighting for the right reason is itself a source of strength.
cards.originalText: Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage, you gain that much life.

cards.name: Orim's Cure
cards.text:
If you control a Plains, you may tap an untapped creature you control rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Prevent the next 4 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
cards.originalText:
If you control a plains, you may tap an untapped creature you control instead of paying the mana cost of Orim's Cure.
Prevent the next 4 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

cards.name: Pious Warrior
cards.text: Whenever Pious Warrior is dealt combat damage, you gain that much life.
cards.flavor: The Cho-Arrim make no distinction between healers and soldiers.
cards.originalText: Whenever Pious Warrior is dealt combat damage, you gain that much life.

cards.name: Ramosian Captain
cards.text:
First strike
{5}, {T}: Search your library for a Rebel permanent card with converted mana cost 4 or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: The Cho-Arrim believe in leading by example.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText:
First strike
{5}, {T}: Search your library for a Rebel card with converted mana cost 4 or less and put that card into play. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Ramosian Commander
cards.text: {6}, {T}: Search your library for a Rebel permanent card with converted mana cost 5 or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: "Cho-Manno guides your spirit. I guide your sword."

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText: {6}, {T}: Search your library for a Rebel card with converted mana cost 5 or less and put that card into play. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Ramosian Lieutenant
cards.text: {4}, {T}: Search your library for a Rebel permanent card with converted mana cost 3 or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: "Give me your hand and I will give you victory."

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText: {4}, {T}: Search your library for a Rebel card with converted mana cost 3 or less and put that card into play. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Ramosian Rally
cards.text:
If you control a Plains, you may tap an untapped creature you control rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
If you control a plains, you may tap an untapped creature you control instead of paying Ramosian Rally's mana cost.
Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Ramosian Sergeant
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Search your library for a Rebel permanent card with converted mana cost 2 or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: Her commands are part rallying cry, part sermon, and wholly undeniable.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText: {3}, {T}: Search your library for a Rebel card with converted mana cost 2 or less and put that card into play. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Ramosian Sky Marshal
cards.text:
Flying
{7}, {T}: Search your library for a Rebel permanent card with converted mana cost 6 or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: The Cho-Arrim fell from the sky onto Mercadia City like a vengeful rain.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText:
Flying
{7}, {T}: Search your library for a Rebel card with converted mana cost 6 or less and put that card into play. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Rappelling Scouts
cards.text:
Flying
{2}{W}: Rappelling Scouts gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{2}{W}: Rappelling Scouts gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.

cards.name: Renounce
cards.text: Sacrifice any number of permanents. You gain 2 life for each permanent sacrificed this way.
cards.flavor: Gerrard offered no defense to Orim's condemnation; the mission was under his command, and he was responsible.

rulings.text: You choose what to sacrifice on resolution.

cards.originalText: Sacrifice any number of permanents. You gain 2 life for each one sacrificed this way.

cards.name: Revered Elder
cards.text: {1}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to Revered Elder this turn.
cards.flavor: The Cho-Arrim worship life and revere those who've experienced it longest.
cards.originalText: {1}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to Revered Elder this turn.

cards.name: Reverent Mantra
cards.text:
You may exile a white card from your hand rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Choose a color. All creatures gain protection from the chosen color until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
You may remove a white card in your hand from the game instead of paying Reverent Mantra's mana cost.
All creatures gain protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.

cards.name: Righteous Aura
cards.text: {W}, Pay 2 life: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
cards.flavor:
"There is a great difference between pain and injury."
—Cho-Manno
cards.originalText: {W}, Pay 2 life: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

cards.name: Righteous Indignation
cards.text: Whenever a creature blocks a black or red creature, the blocking creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "You are the disease that plagues Mercadia. I am the healer's knife that will cut you out."
cards.originalText: Whenever a creature blocks a black or red creature, the blocking creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Security Detail
cards.text: {W}{W}: Create a 1/1 white Soldier creature token. Activate this ability only if you control no creatures and only once each turn.
cards.originalText: {W}{W}: Put a 1/1 white Soldier creature token into play. Play this ability only if you control no creatures and only once each turn.

cards.name: Soothing Balm
cards.text: Target player gains 5 life.
cards.flavor: Orim taught Ta-Karnst and the other Cho-Arrim healers a far less invasive method of healing.
cards.originalText: Target player gains 5 life.

cards.name: Spiritual Focus
cards.text: Whenever a spell or ability an opponent controls causes you to discard a card, you gain 2 life and you may draw a card.
cards.originalText: Whenever a spell or ability an opponent controls causes you to discard a card, you gain 2 life and you may draw a card.

cards.name: Steadfast Guard
cards.text: Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
cards.flavor: The Mercadians were prepared for the guard, but the guard was even more prepared for the Mercadians.
cards.originalText: Attacking doesn't cause Steadfast Guard to tap.

cards.name: Story Circle
cards.text:
As Story Circle enters the battlefield, choose a color.
{W}: The next time a source of your choice of the chosen color would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
cards.originalText:
As Story Circle comes into play, choose a color.
{W}: The next time a source of your choice of the chosen color would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

cards.name: Task Force
cards.text: Whenever Task Force becomes the target of a spell or ability, it gets +0/+3 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: They are the reflection of Rushwood's glow on the edge of a wooden sword.

rulings.text: The +0/+3 bonus is added as a triggered ability upon the casting/activating of a spell or ability which targets this card.

cards.originalText: Whenever Task Force becomes the target of a spell or ability, it gets +0/+3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Thermal Glider
cards.text: Flying, protection from red
cards.flavor:
"The Mercadians are too busy looking down on us to see us coming."
—Cho-Arrim rebel
cards.originalText: Flying, protection from red

cards.name: Tonic Peddler
cards.text: {W}, {T}, Discard a card: Target player gains 3 life.
cards.flavor: "The price is written at the bottom of the cup."
cards.originalText: {W}, {T}, Discard a card from your hand: Target player gains 3 life.

cards.name: Trap Runner
cards.text: {T}: Target unblocked attacking creature becomes blocked. Activate this ability only during combat after blockers are declared. (This ability works on creatures that can't be blocked.)
cards.flavor: "How could I catch her when the trees conspired to stop me?"

rulings.text: If the ability is used on a creature with Trample, the damage still comes through.
This ability will trigger any creature's "whenever this becomes blocked" ability.
If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can be activated during any of them as long as it's after the beginning of that phase's Declare Blockers Step.

cards.originalText: {T}: Target attacking unblocked creature becomes blocked. (This ability works on unblockable creatures.)

cards.name: Wave of Reckoning
cards.text: Each creature deals damage to itself equal to its power.
cards.flavor: Inner conflict can defeat a soldier more quickly than any army.
cards.originalText: Each creature deals to itself damage equal to its power.

cards.name: Wishmonger
cards.text: {2}: Target creature gains protection from the color of its controller's choice until end of turn. Any player may activate this ability.
cards.flavor: "It's not what you ask for, but how you ask for it."
cards.originalText: {2}: Target creature gains protection from the color of its controller's choice until end of turn. Any player may play this ability.

cards.name: Aerial Caravan
cards.text:
Flying
{1}{U}{U}: Exile the top card of your library. Until end of turn, you may play that card. (Reveal the card as you exile it.)
cards.flavor: Successful delivery is not guaranteed.

rulings.text: If you do not play the card by end of turn, it remains exiled. If you play it, it goes wherever the it would normally go when played.

cards.originalText:
Flying
{1}{U}{U}: Remove the top card of your library from the game. Until end of turn, you may play that card as though it were in your hand. (Reveal the card as you remove it from the game.)

cards.name: Balloon Peddler
cards.text: {U}, {T}, Discard a card: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The market festival turned out to be the high point of Jaffy's visit.
cards.originalText: {U}, {T}, Discard a card from your hand: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Blockade Runner
cards.text: {U}: Blockade Runner can't be blocked this turn.
cards.flavor: "I need to get back to Mercadia City," said Sisay. "We can get you there," the vizier answered. "Easily."
cards.originalText: {U}: Blockade Runner is unblockable this turn.

cards.name: Brainstorm
cards.text: Draw three cards, then put two cards from your hand on top of your library in any order.
cards.flavor:
"I see more than others do because I know where to look."
—Saprazzan vizier

rulings.text: You draw three cards and put two cards back all while Brainstorm is resolving. Nothing can happen between the two, and no player may choose to take actions.

cards.originalText: Draw three cards, then put two cards from your hand on top of your library in any order.

cards.name: Bribery
cards.text: Search target opponent's library for a creature card and put that card onto the battlefield under your control. Then that player shuffles their library.
cards.flavor: In Mercadia City, loyalties extend only as far as your purse can stretch.

rulings.text: You put the creature onto the battlefield, so you control it and any "enters the battlefield" abilities it has.
Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText: Search target opponent's library for a creature card and put that card into play under your control. That player then shuffles his or her library.

cards.name: Buoyancy
cards.text:
Flash
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has flying.
cards.flavor: Saprazzan merfolk become legged on land, but some find it quicker to bring the water with them.
cards.originalText:
You may play Buoyancy any time you could play an instant.
Enchanted creature has flying.

cards.name: Chambered Nautilus
cards.text: Whenever Chambered Nautilus becomes blocked, you may draw a card.
cards.flavor: What's merely a home for the nautilus can become exquisite jewelry in the hands of Saprazzan artisans.
cards.originalText: Whenever Chambered Nautilus becomes blocked, you may draw a card.

cards.name: Chameleon Spirit
cards.text:
As Chameleon Spirit enters the battlefield, choose a color.
Chameleon Spirit's power and toughness are each equal to the number of permanents of the chosen color your opponents control.
cards.originalText:
As Chameleon Spirit comes into play, choose a color.
Chameleon Spirit's power and toughness are each equal to the number of permanents of the chosen color your opponents control.

cards.name: Charisma
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage to a creature, gain control of the other creature for as long as Charisma remains on the battlefield.
cards.flavor: It was Gerrard's nature to lead and the Mercadians' to follow.
cards.originalText: Whenever enchanted creature deals damage to a creature, you control that creature as long as Charisma remains in play.

cards.name: Cloud Sprite
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Cloud Sprite can block only creatures with flying.
cards.flavor: The delicate sprites carry messages for Saprazzans, but they refuse to land in Mercadia City's filthy markets.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Cloud Sprite may block only creatures with flying.

cards.name: Coastal Piracy
cards.text: Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage to an opponent, you may draw a card.
cards.flavor: "I don't like to think of myself as a pirate. I'm more like a stimulator of the local economy."

rulings.text: You draw one card per creature, not one per point of damage.

cards.originalText: Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage to an opponent, you may draw a card.

cards.name: Counterspell
cards.text: Counter target spell.
cards.flavor:
"Your attack has been rendered harmless. It is, however, quite pretty."
—Saprazzan vizier
cards.originalText: Counter target spell.

cards.name: Cowardice
cards.text: Whenever a creature becomes the target of a spell or ability, return that creature to its owner's hand. (It won't be affected by the spell or ability.)
cards.flavor: Gerrard was the Mercadian soldiers' greatest hero; they followed him blindly. When he left, they stumbled around blindly.
cards.originalText: Whenever a creature becomes the target of a spell or ability, return that creature to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Customs Depot
cards.text: Whenever you cast a creature spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, draw a card, then discard a card.
cards.flavor: A bribe is always faster than filling out paperwork.
cards.originalText: Whenever you play a creature spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, draw a card, then discard a card from your hand.

cards.name: Darting Merfolk
cards.text: {U}: Return Darting Merfolk to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: You might as well try to catch water with a net.
cards.originalText: {U}: Return Darting Merfolk to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Dehydration
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
cards.flavor:
"You say Saprazzo is a city built on water? I hope they have enough to wash the dust from my throat."
—Sisay
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.

cards.name: Diplomatic Escort
cards.text: {U}, {T}, Discard a card: Counter target spell or ability that targets a creature.
cards.originalText: {U}, {T}, Discard a card from your hand: Counter target spell or ability that targets a creature.

cards.name: Diplomatic Immunity
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Shroud (A permanent with shroud can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
Enchanted creature has shroud.

rulings.text: Shroud does not apply until after it is on the battlefield, so it can be the target of a spell while it is on the stack.

cards.originalText:
Enchanted creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.
Diplomatic Immunity can't be the target of spells or abilities.

cards.name: Drake Hatchling
cards.text:
Flying
{U}: Drake Hatchling gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
cards.flavor: There is beauty in the space between learning to fly and taking it for granted.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{U}: Drake Hatchling gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Play this ability only once each turn.

cards.name: Embargo
cards.text:
Nonland permanents don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you lose 2 life.
cards.originalText:
Nonland permanents don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you lose 2 life.

cards.name: Energy Flux
cards.text: All artifacts have "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this artifact unless you pay {2}."
cards.flavor: Karn said nothing—he just grasped the powerstone and squeezed tightly. The wild flashing ceased.
cards.originalText: All artifacts gain "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this artifact unless you pay {2}."

cards.name: Extravagant Spirit
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Extravagant Spirit unless you pay {1} for each card in your hand.
cards.flavor: The fewer your possessions, the fewer your worries.
cards.originalText:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Extravagant Spirit unless you pay {1} for each card in your hand.

cards.name: False Demise
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature dies, return that card to the battlefield under your control.
cards.flavor: "Go down there and fish him out. Maybe his hide will fetch a price."
cards.originalText: When enchanted creature is put into a graveyard, return that creature to play under your control.

cards.name: Glowing Anemone
cards.text: When Glowing Anemone enters the battlefield, you may return target land to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: Beautiful to behold, terrible to be held.
cards.originalText: When Glowing Anemone comes into play, you may return target land to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Gush
cards.text:
You may return two Islands you control to their owner's hand rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Draw two cards.
cards.flavor: Don't trust your secrets to the sea.
cards.originalText:
You may return two islands you control to their owner's hand instead of paying Gush's mana cost.
Draw two cards.

cards.name: High Seas
cards.text: Red creature spells and green creature spells cost {1} more to cast.
cards.flavor:
Bend as the wave breaks or it will break you as well.
—Saprazzan saying
cards.originalText: Red creature spells and green creature spells cost {1} more to play.

cards.name: Hoodwink
cards.text: Return target artifact, enchantment, or land to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: The youths of Rishada's marketplace are always ready for a quick footrace.
cards.originalText: Return target artifact, enchantment, or land to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Indentured Djinn
cards.text:
Flying
When Indentured Djinn enters the battlefield, each other player may draw up to three cards.
cards.flavor: It's not always clear who's the master and who's the servant.
cards.originalText:
Flying
When Indentured Djinn comes into play, each other player may draw up to three cards.

cards.name: Karn's Touch
cards.text: Target noncreature artifact becomes an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost until end of turn. (It retains its abilities.)

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.originalText: Target noncreature artifact becomes an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost until end of turn. (It retains its abilities.)

cards.name: Misdirection
cards.text:
You may exile a blue card from your hand rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Change the target of target spell with a single target.

rulings.text: Once the spell resolves, the new target is considered to be targeted by the deflected spell. This will trigger any effects which trigger on being targeted.
This only targets the spell being changed, not the original or new target of the spell it is affecting.
The target of a spell that targets another spell on the stack can be changed to any other spell on the stack, even if the new target will resolve before the spell does.
You can't make a spell which is on the stack target itself.

You can choose to make a spell on the stack target this spell (if such a target choice would be legal had the spell been cast while this spell was on the stack). The new target for the deflected spell is not chosen until this spell resolves. This spell is still on the stack when new targets are selected for the spell.
If there is no other legal target for the spell, this does not change the target.
This does not check if the current target is legal. It just checks if the spell has a single target.
You choose the spell to target on announcement, but you pick the new target for that spell on resolution.

cards.originalText:
You may remove a blue card in your hand from the game instead of paying Misdirection's mana cost.
Target spell with a single target targets another target instead.

cards.name: Misstep
cards.text: Creatures target player controls don't untap during that player's next untap step.
cards.flavor:
The feet have no eyes.
—Saprazzan saying

rulings.text: The creatures are only prevented from untapping during the targeted player's next untap step. They can still can untap during other player's untap steps.
No creature controlled by the player will untap during their next untap step. This includes creatures which entered the battlefield after Misstep resolved.

cards.originalText: Creatures target player controls don't untap during that player's next untap step.

cards.name: Overtaker
cards.text: {3}{U}, {T}, Discard a card: Untap target creature and gain control of it until end of turn. That creature gains haste until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "It's no challenge to master a Mercadian."
cards.originalText: {3}{U}, {T}, Discard a card from your hand: Untap target creature and gain control of it until end of turn. That creature gains haste until end of turn. (It may attack and {T} the turn it comes under your control.)

cards.name: Port Inspector
cards.text: Whenever Port Inspector becomes blocked, you may look at defending player's hand.
cards.flavor: "There may be a few minor additional fees, levies, duties, surtaxes, tariffs, imposts, tolls . . . ."
cards.originalText: Whenever Port Inspector becomes blocked, you may look at defending player's hand.

cards.name: Rishadan Airship
cards.text:
Flying
Rishadan Airship can block only creatures with flying.
cards.flavor: The view is truly spectacular—as long as you don't look at Rishada itself.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Rishadan Airship may block only creatures with flying.

cards.name: Rishadan Brigand
cards.text:
Flying
When Rishadan Brigand enters the battlefield, each opponent sacrifices a permanent unless they pay {3}.
Rishadan Brigand can block only creatures with flying.
cards.originalText:
Flying
When Rishadan Brigand comes into play, each opponent sacrifices a permanent unless he or she pays {3}.
Rishadan Brigand may block only creatures with flying.

cards.name: Rishadan Cutpurse
cards.text: When Rishadan Cutpurse enters the battlefield, each opponent sacrifices a permanent unless they pay {1}.
cards.flavor:
The bigger the purse, the greater the fool.
—Rishadan saying
cards.originalText: When Rishadan Cutpurse comes into play, each opponent sacrifices a permanent unless he or she pays {1}.

cards.name: Rishadan Footpad
cards.text: When Rishadan Footpad enters the battlefield, each opponent sacrifices a permanent unless they pay {2}.
cards.flavor: "The best things in life are free. Money, for instance."
cards.originalText: When Rishadan Footpad comes into play, each opponent sacrifices a permanent unless he or she pays {2}.

cards.name: Sailmonger
cards.text: {2}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn. Any player may activate this ability.
cards.flavor: Clients who cheat the sailmonger make an impact on the rest.
cards.originalText: {2}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn. Any player may play this ability.

cards.name: Sand Squid
cards.text:
Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
You may choose not to untap Sand Squid during your untap step.
{T}: Tap target creature. That creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step for as long as Sand Squid remains tapped.
cards.originalText:
Islandwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls an island.)
You may choose not to untap Sand Squid during your untap step.
{T}: Tap target creature. That creature does not untap during its controller's untap step as long as Sand Squid remains tapped.

cards.name: Saprazzan Bailiff
cards.text:
When Saprazzan Bailiff enters the battlefield, exile all artifact and enchantment cards from all graveyards.
When Saprazzan Bailiff leaves the battlefield, return all artifact and enchantment cards from all graveyards to their owners' hands.
cards.originalText:
When Saprazzan Bailiff comes into play, remove all artifact and enchantment cards in all graveyards from the game.
When Saprazzan Bailiff leaves play, return all artifact and enchantment cards from all graveyards to their owners' hands.

cards.name: Saprazzan Breaker
cards.text: {U}: Put the top card of your library into your graveyard. If that card is a land card, Saprazzan Breaker can't be blocked this turn.
cards.originalText: {U}: Put the top card of your library into your graveyard. If that card is a land card, Saprazzan Breaker is unblockable this turn.

cards.name: Saprazzan Heir
cards.text: Whenever Saprazzan Heir becomes blocked, you may draw three cards.
cards.flavor: Within the walls of the floating city, Saprazzan wealth is like Saprazzan water: abundant, free-flowing, and accessible to all.

rulings.text: It triggers only once even if blocked by more than one creature.

cards.originalText: Whenever Saprazzan Heir becomes blocked, you may draw three cards.

cards.name: Saprazzan Legate
cards.text:
If an opponent controls a Mountain and you control an Island, you may cast this spell without paying its mana cost.
Flying
cards.originalText:
Flying
If an opponent controls a mountain and you control an island, you may play Saprazzan Legate without paying its mana cost.

cards.name: Saprazzan Outrigger
cards.text: When Saprazzan Outrigger attacks or blocks, put it on top of its owner's library at end of combat.
cards.flavor: The Saprazzans excel at both tactics: hit and run.
cards.originalText: When Saprazzan Outrigger attacks or blocks, put it on top of its owner's library at end of combat.

cards.name: Saprazzan Raider
cards.text: When Saprazzan Raider becomes blocked, return it to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: Some quick dagger work and then back to the sea—that's the Saprazzan way.

rulings.text: It returns as soon as it is blocked. It does not remain on the battlefield long enough to deal damage.

cards.originalText: When Saprazzan Raider becomes blocked, return it to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Shoving Match
cards.text: Until end of turn, all creatures gain "{T}: Tap target creature."
cards.flavor: Rishadan barkeeps know something the Mercadians have yet to learn: if you keep pushing, someone will eventually push back.
cards.originalText: Until end of turn, all creatures gain "{T}: Tap target creature."

cards.name: Soothsaying
cards.text:
{3}{U}{U}: Shuffle your library.
{X}: Look at the top X cards of your library, then put them back in any order.
cards.flavor: The vizier's wisdom proved invaluable in untangling the Mercadian knot of lies.
cards.originalText:
{3}{U}{U}: Shuffle your library.
{X}: Look at the top X cards of your library and put them back in any order.

cards.name: Squeeze
cards.text: Sorcery spells cost {3} more to cast.
cards.flavor: Any pirate would prefer Rishada's swift and cruel justice to Saprazzo's patient punishments.
cards.originalText: Sorcery spells cost {3} more to play.

cards.name: Statecraft
cards.text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by creatures you control.
cards.flavor:
"Inside these walls, peace; outside, sharks. You choose."
—Saprazzan vizier
cards.originalText: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by creatures you control.

cards.name: Stinging Barrier
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{U}, {T}: Stinging Barrier deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.originalText:
(Walls can't attack.)
{U}, {T}: Stinging Barrier deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Thwart
cards.text:
You may return three Islands you control to their owner's hand rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Counter target spell.
cards.originalText:
You may return three islands you control to their owner's hand instead of paying Thwart's mana cost.
Counter target spell.

cards.name: Tidal Bore
cards.text:
You may return an Island you control to its owner's hand rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
You may tap or untap target creature.
cards.flavor: The dry riverbed became a raging torrent, and the Cho-Arrim claimed their prize.
cards.originalText:
You may return an island you control to its owner's hand instead of paying Tidal Bore's mana cost.
Tap or untap target creature.

cards.name: Tidal Kraken
cards.text: Tidal Kraken can't be blocked.
cards.flavor: To merfolk, pirates are a nuisance. To pirates, merfolk are a threat. To the kraken, they're both appetizers.
cards.originalText: Tidal Kraken is unblockable.

cards.name: Timid Drake
cards.text:
Flying
When another creature enters the battlefield, return Timid Drake to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: It flees from anything that isn't shaped like a cloud.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever another creature comes into play, return Timid Drake to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Trade Routes
cards.text:
{1}: Return target land you control to its owner's hand.
{1}, Discard a land card: Draw a card.
cards.flavor: Like the price of goods, the value of the routes was renegotiated daily.
cards.originalText:
{1}: Return target land you control to its owner's hand.
{1}, Discard a land card from your hand: Draw a card.

cards.name: War Tax
cards.text: {X}{U}: This turn, creatures can't attack unless their controller pays {X} for each attacking creature they control.
cards.flavor: The worst thing about being a depraved pirate is having to work with a bunch of depraved pirates.

rulings.text: You can choose X=0. This doesn't have an effect most of the time, but it does mean that creatures can't attack unless the controller chooses to pay the cost (a cost of zero is not automatically paid, so the controller can choose to not pay).
The ability only applies to attackers declared after it resolves. It will not add costs to any attackers already announced.
In the Two-Headed Giant format, you still only have to pay once per creature.

cards.originalText: {X}{U}: Creatures can't attack this turn unless their controller pays {X} for each attacking creature.

cards.name: Waterfront Bouncer
cards.text: {U}, {T}, Discard a card: Return target creature to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: Closing time comes earlier to some than to others.
cards.originalText: {U}, {T}, Discard a card from your hand: Return target creature to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Alley Grifters
cards.text: Whenever Alley Grifters becomes blocked, defending player discards a card.
cards.flavor: One distracts the victim, the other extracts the valuables.

rulings.text: It triggers only once even if blocked by more than one creature.

cards.originalText: Whenever Alley Grifters becomes blocked, defending player discards a card from his or her hand.

cards.name: Black Market
cards.text:
Whenever a creature dies, put a charge counter on Black Market.
At the beginning of your precombat main phase, add {B} for each charge counter on Black Market.

rulings.text: Getting the mana is not optional.

cards.originalText:
Whenever a creature is put into a graveyard from play, put a charge counter on Black Market.
At the beginning of your precombat main phase, add {B} to your mana pool for each charge counter on Black Market.

cards.name: Bog Smugglers
cards.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
cards.flavor: They slide over the bog like oil across glass.
cards.originalText: Swampwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls a swamp.)

cards.name: Bog Witch
cards.text: {B}, {T}, Discard a card: Add {B}{B}{B}.
cards.flavor: The world is the body. The mana is the blood. The witch is the surgeon.

rulings.text: The ability is a mana ability.

cards.originalText: {B}, {T}, Discard a card from your hand: Add {B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.
